problems.title: Team
problems.description:
One day three best friends Petya, Vasya and Tonya decided to form a team and take part in programming contests. Participants are usually offered several problems during programming contests. Long before the start the friends decided that they will implement a problem if at least two of them are sure about the solution. Otherwise, the friends won't write the problem's solution.

This contest offers n problems to the participants. For each problem we know, which friend is sure about the solution. Help the friends find the number of problems for which they will write a solution.
problems.input: The first input line contains a single integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 1000) — the number of problems in the contest. Then n lines contain three integers each, each integer is either 0 or 1. If the first number in the line equals 1, then Petya is sure about the problem's solution, otherwise he isn't sure. The second number shows Vasya's view on the solution, the third number shows Tonya's view. The numbers on the lines are separated by spaces.
problems.output: Print a single integer — the number of problems the friends will implement on the contest.

hints.title: Pista 1
hints.content: Count how many problems have at least 2 friends sure about the solution.

hints.title: Pista 2
hints.content: For each line, sum the three numbers. If sum >= 2, increment the answer.

hints.title: Pista 3
hints.content: Use a simple loop to iterate through all n problems.

code.Python:
n = int(input())
count = 0
for _ in range(n):
    a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
    if a + b + c >= 2:
        count += 1
print(count)

problems.title: Way Too Long Words
problems.description:
Sometimes some words like "localization" or "internationalization" are so long that writing them many times in one article is quite tiresome.

Let's consider a word too long, if its length is strictly greater than 10 characters.

All too long words should be replaced with a special abbreviation.

This abbreviation is made by writing down the first and the last letter of a word, and between them - the count of letters between the first and the last letters.

For example, "localization" will be spelt as "l10n", and "internationalization" will be spelt as "i18n".

You are suggested to automatize the process of changing the words with abbreviations. Given a word, you need to replace it with the abbreviation if the word is too long.
problems.input: The first line contains an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 100). Then n lines follow. Each line contains a word. All the words consist only of lowercase English letters and each word contains at most 100 characters.
problems.output: Print n lines. The i-th line should contain the result of replacing of the i-th word from the input data.

hints.title: Pista 1
hints.content: Check if word length > 10, then abbreviate it.
